performances.description: There are a couple versions that people generally argue for, but this one is and always will be my favorite.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: The first live version needs to be on this list, very well sung by Garcia and well played. They didn’t play this song enough.

performances.venue: Laguna Seca Recreation Area Monterey, CA
performances.description: Jerry rips a sweet solo in the middle of this one.  Emotive closing lyrics
This is a good version and I really like the tone on Garcia’s guitar during the solo and great closing vocals.  Give it a listen.

performances.venue: Greek Theater - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: A good version of this underrated song.
A cool version from a great show.

performances.venue: Studio-Inn By The Sea Tape Cape Elizabeth, ME
performances.description: Part of the Inn BY The Sea tapes. These tape are full of kool nuggets!
Well it used to be on this date until mr bean and his brain dump gangstalking cronies moved it. Mind reading folks. What a gonna do. Mr bean is a thie
Fine, soulful performance. Garcia sings "in a world time forgot" instead of "that guitars never caught." Alternate lyric they maybe wanted to put.
